name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: [SOUND] This lecture is about

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: the text retrieval problem.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: This picture shows our overall plan for lectures.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _In the last lecture
column6: we talked about the high level strategies for text access. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: We talked about push versus pull.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Search engines are the main tools for supporting the pull mode.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Starting from this lecture

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: we're going to talk about the how search engines work in detail.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So first
column6: it's about the text retrieval problem. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: We're going to talk about the three things in this lecture.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _First
column6: we'll define text retrieval. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Second
column6: we're going to make a comparison between text retrieval and _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _the related task
column6: database retrieval. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Finally
column6: we're going to talk about the document selection versus document ranking _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: as two strategies for responding to a user's query.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So what is text retrieval?

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: It should be a task that's familiar to most of us because we're using web

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: search engines all the time.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So text retrieval is basically a task where the system would respond

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _to a user's query with relevant lock-ins
column6: basically through _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: supported querying as one way to implement the poor mold of information access.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So the scenario's the following.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: You have a collection of text documents.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: These documents could be all the web pages on the web.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Or all the literature articles in the digital library or

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: maybe all the text files in your computer.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: A user will typically give a query to the system to express the information need.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And then the system would return relevant documents to users.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Relevant documents refer to those documents that are useful to the user who

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: typed in the query.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Now this task is a often called information retrieval.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _But literally
column6: information retrieval would broadly include the retrieval of _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: other non-textual information as well.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _For example
column6: audio

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: It's worth noting that text retrieval is at the core of

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: information retrieval in the sense that other medias such as

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: video can be retrieved by exploiting the companion text data.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So for example
column6: can the image search engines actually _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: match a user's query with the companion text data of the image?

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _This problem is also called the
column6: the search problem

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: and the technology is often called search technology in industry.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _If you ever take on course in databases

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: it'll be useful to pause the lecture at this point and

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: think about the differences between text retrieval and database retrieval.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Now these two tasks are similar in many ways.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: But there are some important differences.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So
column6: spend a moment to think about the differences between the two. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Think about the data and information managed by a search engine versus

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _those that are man
column6: managed by a database system. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Think about the difference between the queries that you typically specify for

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: a database system versus the queries that typed in by users on the search engine.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And then finally think about the answers.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: What's the difference between the two?

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Okay
column6: so _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: if we think probably the information out there are managed by the two systems.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _We will see that in text retrieval
column6: the data is unstructured

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _But in databases
column6: they are structured data
column7: where there is a clear defined _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: schema to tell you this column is the names of people and

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _that column is ages
column6: et cetera. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _In unstructured text

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: it's not obvious what are the names of people mentioned in the text.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Because of this difference

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: we can also see that text information tends to be more ambiguous.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And we'll talk about that in the natural language processing lecture.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Whereas in databases
column6: the data tend to have well-defined semantics. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _There is also important difference in the queries
column6: and _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _this is partly due to the difference in the information
column6: or data. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So text queries tend to be ambiguous
column6: whereas in their research

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: the queries are particularly well-defined.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Think about the SQL query

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: that would clear the specify what records to be returned.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So it has very well defined semantics.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Queue all queries or naturally ending queries tend to be incomplete.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Also in that it doesn't really

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: fully specify what documents should be retrieved.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Whereas
column6: in the database search

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: can be regarded as a computer specification for what should be returned.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And because of these differences
column6: the answers would be also different. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _In the case of text retrieval
column6: we're looking for relevant documents. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _In the database search
column6: we are retrieving records or _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _matched records with the SQL query
column6: more precisely. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Now in the case of text retrieval
column6: what should be the right answers to _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _a query is not very well specified
column6: as we just discussed. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So it's unclear what should be the right answers to a query.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And this has very important consequences
column6: and _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: that is text retrieval is an empirically defined problem.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And so this a problem because if it's empirically defined

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: then we cannot mathematically prove one method is better than another method.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: That also means we must rely on emperical evaluation

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: more than users to know which method works better.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And that's why we have one lecture

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: actually more than one lectures to cover the issue of evaluation.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Because this is a very important topic for search engines.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Without knowing how to evaluate an algorithm appropriately

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: there's no way to tell whether we have got the better algorithm or

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: whether one system is better than another.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So now let's look at the problem in a formal way.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So this slide shows a formal formulation of the text retrieval problem.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _First
column6: we have our vocabulary set which is just a set of words in a language. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Now here
column6: we're considering just one language

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: in reality on the web there might be multiple natural languages.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: We have text that are in all kinds of languages.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _But here for simplicity
column6: we just assume there is one kind of language. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _As the techniques used for retrieving data from multiple languages

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Are more or less similar to the techniques used for

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: retrieving documents in one language.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Although there is important difference
column6: the principles and _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: methods are very similar.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Next we have the query
column6: which is a sequence of words. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And so here you can see the query

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: is defined as a sequence of words.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Each q sub i is a word in the vocabulary.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: A document is defined in the same way.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So it's also a sequence of words.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And here
column6: d sub ij is also a word in the vocabulary. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Now typically
column6: the documents are much longer than queries. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: But there are also cases where the documents may be very short.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So you can think about the
column6: what might be a example of that case. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _I hope you can think of
column6: of twitter search

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Tweets are very short.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _But in general
column6: documents are longer then the queries. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Now
column6: then we have a collection of documents. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And this collection can be very large.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So think about the web.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _It could
column6: could be very large. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And then the goal of text retrieval is you'll find the set of relevant documents

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _which we denote by R of q
column6: because it depends on the query. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And this is
column6: in general
column7: a subset of all the documents in the collection. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Unfortunately
column6: this set of random documents is generally unknown

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: and usually depend in the sense that for the same query typed

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _in by different users
column6: the expected relevant documents may be different. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: The query given to us by the user is only a hint

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: on which document should be in this set.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And indeed
column6: the user is generally unable to specify what exactly should be in _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _the set
column6: especially in the case of a web search where the collection is so large. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: The user doesn't have complete knowledge about the whole collection.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So
column6: the best a search system can do is _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: to compute an approximation of this relevent document set.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So we denote it by R prime of q.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So
column6: formally
column7: we can see the task is to compute this R prime of q

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: an approximation of the relevant documents.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So how can we do that?

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Now
column6: imagine if you are now asked to write a program to do this. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: What would you do?

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Now think for a moment.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Right
column6: so these are your input. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _With the query
column6: the documents and _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _then you will have computed the answers to this query

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: which is set of documents that would be useful to the user.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So how would you solve the problem?

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: In general there are two strategies that we can use.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _All right
column6: the first strategy is to do document selection. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And that is
column6: we're going to have a binary classification function

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: binary classified.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: That's a function that will take a document and

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _query as input
column6: and then give a zero or one as output

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _to indicate whether this document is relevant to the query
column6: or not. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So in this case
column6: you can see the document. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _The
column6: the relevant document set is defined as follows. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _It basically
column6: all the documents that _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: have a value of one by this function.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And so in this case

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: you can see the system must have decided if a document is relevant or not.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Basically
column6: that has to say whether it's one or zero. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And this is called absolute relevance.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Basically
column6: it needs to know exactly whether it's going to be useful _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: to the user.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Alternatively
column6: there's another strategy called document ranking. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Now in this case

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: the system is not going to make a call whether a document is relevant or not.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Rather
column6: the system's going to use a real value function

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: here that would simply give us a value.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: That would indicate which document is more likely relevant.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So it's not going to make a call whether this document is relevant or not

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: but rather it would say which document is more likely relevant.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So this function then can be used to rank the documents.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And then we're going to let the user decide where to stop when the user looks

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: at the documents.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So we have a threshold
column6: theta

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: what documents should be in this approximation set.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And we're going to assume that all the documents that are ranked above this

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: threshold are in the set.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Because in effect
column6: these are the documents that we delivered to the user. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And theta is a cutoff determined by the user.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So here we've got some collaboration from

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _the user in some sense because we don't really make a cutoff
column6: and _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: the user kind of helped the system make a cutoff.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So in this case
column6: the system only needs to decide if one document is more likely _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: relevant than another.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And that is
column6: it only needs for _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: determined relative relevance as opposed to absolute relevance.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Now you can probably already sense that relevant

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: relative relevance would be easier to determine the absolute relevance.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Because in the first case

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _we have to say exactly whether a document is relevant or not
column6: right? _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And it turns out that ranking is indeed generally preferred to document selection.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So let's look this these two strategies in more detail.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So this pictures shows how it works.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So on the left side
column6: we see these documents. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And we use the pluses to indicate the relevant documents.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So we can see the true relevant documents here consists

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _this set of true relevant documents consists of these pluses
column6: these documents. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And with the document selection function

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _we can do
column6: basically classify them into two groups

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: relevant documents and non-relevant ones.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Of course
column6: the classifier will not be perfect

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So here we can see in the approximation of

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: the relevant documents we have got some non-relevant documents.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And similarly
column6: there's a relevant document that that's misclassified as non-relevant. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _In the case of document ranking
column6: we can see the system seems like _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: simply ranks all the documents in the descending order of the scores.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And we're going to let the user stop wherever the user wants to stop.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So if a user wants to examine more documents
column6: then the user will _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: go down the list to examine more and stop at the lower position.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _But if the user only wants to read a few random documents

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: the user might stop at the top position.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So in this case
column6: the user stops at d4

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: we have delivered these four documents to our user.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So as I said
column6: ranking is generally preferred. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And one of the reasons is because the classifier

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _in the case of document selection
column6: is unlikely accurate. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Why? Because the only clue is usually

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: the query.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _But the query may not be accurate
column6: in the sense that it could be overly constrained. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _For example
column6: you might expect the relevant documents to talk about all these _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _topics you
column6: by using specific vocabulary

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _you might match no random documents
column6: because in the collection

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: no others have discussed the topic using these vocabularies.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: All right.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So in this case
column6: we'll see there is this problem of _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: no relevant documents to return in the case of overly constrained query.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _On the other hand
column6: if the query is under constrained

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: if the query does not have sufficient discriminating words you'll

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _find in relevant documents
column6: you may actually end up having. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: over delivery.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And this is when you thought these words might be sufficient to

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _help you find the relevant documents
column6: but it turns out that they're not sufficient. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And there are many distraction documents using similar words.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And so this is the case of over delivery.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Unfortunately
column6: it's very hard to find the right position between these two extremes. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Why?

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Because
column6: when the users looking for the information in general

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: the user does not have a good knowledge about the the information to be found.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And in that case
column6: the user does not have a good knowledge about _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: what vocabularies will be used in those random documents.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So it's very hard for a user to pre-specify

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: the right level of of constraints.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Even if the class file is accurate
column6: we also still want to rank these _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: relevant documents because they are generally not equally relevant.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Relevance is often a matter of degree.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So we must prioritize these documents for user to exam.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And this
column6: note that this prioritization is very important

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: because a user cannot digest all the contents at once.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: The user generally would have to look at each document sequentially.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And therefore
column6: it would make sense to feed users with the most _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _relevant documents
column6: and that's what ranking is doing. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So for these reasons ranking is generally preferred.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Now
column6: this preference also has a theoretical justification

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: this is given by the probability ranking principle.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: In the end of this lecture there is a reference for this.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _This principal says
column6: returning a ranked list of documents in descending order of _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _probability
column6: that a document is relevant to the query

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: is the optimal strategy under the following two assumptions.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _First
column6: the utility of a document to a user _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Is independent of the utility of any other document.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Second
column6: a user would be assumed to browse the results sequentially. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Now it's easy to understand why these two assumptions are needed

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _in order to justify for the ranking
column6: strategy. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Because
column6: if the documents are independent

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: then we can evaluate the utility of each document that's separate.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And this would allow us to compute a score for each document independently.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And then we're going to rank these documents based on those scores.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: The second assumption is to say that the user would indeed follow the rank list.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _If the user is not going to follow the ranked list
column6: is not going to examine _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _the documents sequentially
column6: then obviously the ordering would not be optimal. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So under these two assumptions
column6: we can theoretically justify the ranking strategy _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: is in fact the best that you could do.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Now I've put one question here.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Do these 2 assumptions hold?

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Now I suggest you to pause the lecture for a moment to think about these.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Now can you think of some examples that would suggest

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: these assumptions aren't necessarily true?

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Now if you think for

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: a moment you may realize none of the assumptions is actually true.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _For example in the case of independence assumption
column6: we might have _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: identical documents that have similar content or exactly the same content.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _If you look at each of them alone
column6: each is relevant. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _But if the user has already seen one of them
column6: we assume it's _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: generally not very useful for the user to see another similar or duplicate one.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So clearly the utility of a document is dependent

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: on other documents that the user has seen.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _In some other cases
column6: you might see a scenario where one document that may not _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _be useful to the user
column6: but when three particular documents are put together

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: they provide answer to the user's question.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So this is collective relevance.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And that also suggests that the value of the document

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: might depend on other documents.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Sequential browsing generally would make sense if you have a ranked list there.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _But even if you have a run list
column6: there is evidence showing that _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: users don't always just go strictly sequentially through the entire list.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _They sometimes would look at the bottom for example
column6: or skip some. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And if you think about the more complicated interfaces that would possibly

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _use like
column6: two dimensional interface where you can put additional information _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _on the screen
column6: then sequential browsing is a very restrictive assumption. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So the point here is that

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _none of these assumptions is really true
column6: but nevertheless

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: the probability ranking principle establishes some solid foundation for

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: ranking as a primary task for search engines.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And this has actually been the basis for

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: a lot of research work in information retrieval.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And many algorithms have been designed based on this assumption.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Despite that the assumptions aren't necessarily true.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And we can
column6: address this problem by doing post processing of a ranked list. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _For example
column6: to remove redundancy. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _So to summarize this lecture

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: the main points that you can take away are the following.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _First
column6: text retrieval is an empirically defined problem. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: And that means which algorithm is better must be judged by the users.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _Second
column6: document ranking is generally prefer and _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _this is
column6: will help users prioritize examination of search results. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _And this is also to bypass the difficulty in determining absolute relevance

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: because we can get some help from users in determining where to make the cut off.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: It's more flexible.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: So this further suggests that the main technical challenge

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: in designing the search engine is with designing effective ranking function.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _In other words
column6: we need to define what is the value of this function f _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: on the query and document pair.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Now how to design such a function is a main topic in the following lectures.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: There are two suggested additional readings.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: The first is the classic paper on probability ranking principle.

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _The second
column6: is a must read for anyone doing research information retrieval. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _It's classical IR book
column6: which has excellent coverage of _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _the main research results in early days
column6: up to the time when the book was written. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: Chapter six of this book has an in depth discussion of

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _the probability of the ranking principal
column6: and _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: _the probabilistic retrieval models
column6: in general. _

name: 2 - 3 - 1.3 Text Retrieval Problem (00-26-18).srt
text: [MUSIC]
